register.reg_long_name: Performance Monitors Count Enable Clear register
register.reg_condition: when AArch32 is supported and FEAT_PMUv3 is implemented

purpose_text.para: Disables the Cycle Count Register, PMCCNTR, and any implemented event counters PMEVCNTR<n>. Reading this register shows which counters are enabled.
PMCNTENCLR is used in conjunction with the PMCNTENSET register.

field_description.para: PMCCNTR disable. On writes, allows software to disable PMCCNTR. On reads, returns the PMCCNTR enable status.
Accessing this field has the following behavior:

listitem.content: This field reads-as-zero and ignores writes if all of the following are true: is implemented. Accessed at EL0. EL1 is using AArch64. PMUSERENR_EL0.UEN == 1. PMUACR_EL1.C == 0.
This field ignores writes if all of the following are true: is implemented. Accessed at EL0. EL1 is using AArch64. PMUSERENR_EL0.{UEN,CR} == {1,1}.
Otherwise access to this field is W1C.

field_description.para: PMEVCNTR<m> disable. On writes, allows software to disable PMEVCNTR<m>. On reads, returns the PMEVCNTR<m> enable status.
Accessing this field has the following behavior:

listitem.content:
This field reads-as-zero and ignores writes if any of the following are true: All of the following are true: is implemented. Accessed at EL0. EL1 is using AArch64. PMUSERENR_EL0.UEN == 1. PMUACR_EL1.P<m> == 0.
All of the following are true: EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state. m >= UInt(MDCR_EL2.HPMN). EL2 using AArch64. Accessed at EL0 or EL1.
All of the following are true: EL2 is implemented and enabled in the current Security state. m >= UInt(HDCR.HPMN). EL2 using AArch32. Accessed at EL0 or EL1.
m >= UInt(PMCR.N).
This field ignores writes if all of the following are true: is implemented. Accessed at EL0. EL1 is using AArch64. PMUSERENR_EL0.{UEN,ER} == {1,1}.
Otherwise access to this field is W1C.

ps.name: MRC
MCR
